messages.content:
Swarm robotics, inspired by collective behaviors in biological systems, has progressed substantially through advances in decentralized coordination, adaptive formation control, and energy‑efficient task allocation. A distributed consensus algorithm enables large robot swarms to achieve coordinated movement with minimal communication overhead, demonstrating robustness in dynamically changing environments (Smith et al., 2022). Reinforcement‑learning‑based formation control further allows heterogeneous swarms to maintain adaptive configurations, improving trajectory‑tracking accuracy by 35 % relative to conventional methods (Patel & Nguyen, 2021). Additionally, an energy‑aware task allocation scheme reduces overall power consumption by 22 % while preserving mission success rates, highlighting the critical role of resource‑conscious strategies for large‑scale deployments (Garcia & Zhou, 2023).

**References**

Garcia, E., & Zhou, F. (2023). Energy-efficient task allocation in large-scale swarm systems. arXiv. https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.04567
